item.title: New Ranks
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

Add a new token, like if you want “Shitty People”, for example, you’d add this token:

public int Shitty = 0;

} else if (token.equals("character-Shitty")) {
        Shitty = Integer.parseInt(token2);
characterfile.newLine();
characterfile.write("character-Shitty = ", 0, 21);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(Shitty), 0, Integer.toString(Shitty).length());

And then, you would add a command to make a person shitty.

[code=java]
if (command.startsWith(“makeshitty”) && playerRights >= 2){
String name = command.substring(11);

        try {
            int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
            client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];

            c.Shitty = 1;
            c.disconnected = true;
            c.sM("You are shitty! Woot!");
            sM(name + "is now shitty!);
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sM(name + " either isn't online or doesn't exist");
        }

}[/code]

And if you want shitty people to be able to ban people, you would use this ban command:

[code=java]
if (command.startsWith(“banuser”) && Shitty == 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(8);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

		writeLog(p.playerName, "bans");
		p.disconnected = true;
		sM("You have banned "+p.playerName+"!");
                    yell("["+playerName+"] has just banned "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to ban..");
            }
        }[/code]

Read full topic
